Robert Lucente wrote:

> Ooops on my part.
> 
> I was trying to stimulate conversation to explicitly define "best".

I think I understand. I submit that defining "best" is rarely helpful, 
especially when we first need to agree on what's "worst"!

> Next time, I will have to select possible alternative choices more
> carefully.
> 
> Needless to say, I would never ask my clients to add 1 GB of RAM to run my
> software unless I had exhausted all other possible alternatives.

Actually, it needs to be said. There are plenty of so-called 
professionals out there that think nothing of telling their clients to 
add 1 GB RAM, because, after all, "RAM is cheap." (That's true in many 
cases, but not all.) It's good to know you've not one of those people. :)

Take care.
